result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. James A Wetzel

defendant.name: Wetzel, James A
defendant.address: N53 W34404 Road Q, Oconomowoc, WI 53066

records.addlTxt:
8:51 AM; Case called for Hearing. Defendant James A Wetzel in court.  Prosecuting attorney Chelsea Thompson in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court inquires if the defendant plans to retain counsel.  Defendant advises that he has some updated paperwork with respect to his program and provides the information to the State.  State has reviewed the letter and notes he is set to complete the program in January 2023.  State recommends setting one more further proceedings just to verify the defendant has completed the program.  Court will adjourn for further proceedings in mid-January 2023.
Hearing scheduled for January 18, 2023 at 08:30 am.

9:02 AM; Case called for Hearing. Prosecuting attorney Charles Patrick Hoffmann in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant James A Wetzel in court. Court inquires if the defendant plans to retain counsel.  Defendant advises he is aware of his right to an attorney but will proceed pro se based on the offer from the State.  Defendant advises he has proof he is enrolled in the program needed for the offer.  State confirms but notes that the program will take a while, so they are ok with adjourning the matter for status.  Court adjourns for status in 60 days.
Hearing scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 7 Judicial Vacancy, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).

Defendant is not to have any violent contact with individual listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.   Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.    Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to enter any premises, other than a grocery store, that sells/serves alcohol beverages by the drink or into any liquor store.  Cash bail previously posted to be refunded to poster.

09:46 AM Defendant James A Wetzel in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.  Hearing scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Order to Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key signed by Judge Laura Lau 06/29/2022.
Victim/Witness Identification Key filed, under seal,  by the District Attorney's office.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor
